body_html:
Make sure you have tensorflow GPU version installed and/or its point to the write env which has GPU version installed
Also check what devices are getting recognized . If you don't see GPU then its not the right env or TF-gpu.
uninstall tensorflow and reinstall tensorflow-gpu
//////////// Try this below
import tensorflow as tf
from tensorflow.python.client import device_lib
print(device_lib.list_local_devices())
/////////// You should get logs like below with various devices getting recognized
[name: "/device:CPU:0"
device_type: "CPU"
memory_limit: 268435456
locality {
}
incarnation: 17806258439xxxxxxxxx
, name: "/device:GPU:0"
device_type: "GPU"
memory_limit: 3170530099
locality {
bus_id: 1
links {
}
}
incarnation: 141133486494xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
physical_device_desc: "device: 0, name: GeForce GTX 970, pci bus id: 0000:02:00.0, compute capability: 5.2"
, name: "/device:GPU:1"
device_type: "GPU"
memory_limit: 3170530099
locality {
bus_id: 1
links {
}
}
incarnation: 163427xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
physical_device_desc: "device: 1, name: GeForce GTX 970, pci bus id: 0000:03:00.0, compute capability: 5.2"
]

Try this too

if tf.test.gpu_device_name():
print('Default GPU Device: {}'.format(tf.test.gpu_device_name()))
else:
print("Please install GPU version of TF")
////////////////////// output
Default GPU Device: /device:GPU:0
/////////////////////////////
as n0t0ri0us mentioned please provide more details about the environment(linux,osx,windows,gpu card, pip/conda etc) and show some complete logs. Lets us know what worked .
